lead_paragraph: LAMM--Rabbi Maurice. The National Institute for Jewish Institute mourns the passing of our founder and president, Rabbi Maurice Lamm. The former Rabbi of Beth Jacob of Beverly Hills, California, he was the author of five major books, including "The Jewish Way In Death and Mourning," and held the Chair in Professional Rabbinics at Yeshiva University. He lectured around the world. He is survived by his wife Shirley, his son David, his daughter Dodi, 18 grandchildren and 35 great-grandchildren. Shiva will be upon return from Israel Monday and Tuesday at 732 University St., North Woodmere, NY. Donations in his memory can be made online at nijh.org. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  LAMM, RABBI MAURICE
